share.message: Gmail knows where you are when you read your emails. It's your data, start taking it back on https://www.mytiki.com

cover.subtitle: Gmail knows...
cover.text:
Your Gmail account tracks your location when you open your emails...
Every single time you do it.

explain.text:
every time you open your inbox or send an email.

Most Google products and almost all email services do this. Some, like Outlook, but NOT Gmail, will even send your IP address to the person receiving your email.

The most common use approximates your location, pinpointing you within 3-5 miles anywhere in the world. In extreme cases, like criminal investigations, your IP address can be tied to your exact device and location by working with an Internet Service Provider.

theySay.text: Analyzing patterns to develop new features and products

shouldKnow.text: Used advertisers for location-based targeting and surveillance
Saved for 9 months, then obscured and kept permanently

explain.text: to hide your IP address or, for true anonymity, switch to an

.

Gmail does not currently use additional location services.

If you just hate the ads, you can turn off ad personalization for your entire Google account.

share.message: Gmail knows what you've written to your friends. Find out more on https://www.mytiki.com

cover.subtitle: Gmail knows...
cover.text: Gmail has all emails you’ve ever written to anyone. They look at the content in the emails, so they know you better.

explain.text:
Gmail has access to your emails - it reads, stores and analyzes them.

Google uses this information for targeted ads and what they call “smart features” like automatically adding your flight information to your calendar.

In their own words:


Creepy.

theySay.text: Travel assistance like itineraries, updates, and maps.
Smart email with suggestions, nudges, prioritization, and filtering
Track packages, reservations, loyalty cards, and bills

shouldKnow.text: Used by advertisers for key word targetting

explain.text: and “smart features” to stop Google from scanning your emails.

share.message: Gmail knows what you've written to your friends. Find out more on https://www.mytiki.com

cover.subtitle: Gmail knows...
cover.bigTextDark: you do in your Gmail app
cover.text: Your Gmail app has quite a lot of analytics packed in and knows quite a few things....

explain.text:
Gmail’s app is designed to track most of the things you do with it. It tracks each action you take, on which device, OS, and time of day.

For example, when you opened the app, what you searched for and if you saw an ad were all tracked.

Your audio is recorded if you use voice search or assistant with Gmail.

shouldKnow.text: Your activity is tracked even when logged out
You can set your history to auto delete after 3, 18, or 36 months

explain.text: You can delete all activities, individual activities, set it to auto-delete, or disable activity tracking entirely.
